intro: Coelachne perpusilla, commonly known as the dwarf false brome, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, tufted growth habit and slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale blue or white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, with a distinctive blue-green coloration. Coelachne perpusilla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
